verses.kjv: In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed unto Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar; and the thing was true, but the time appointed was long: and he understood the thing, and had understanding of the vision.
verses.web: In the third year of Cyrus king of Persia a thing was revealed to Daniel, whose name was called Belteshazzar; and the thing was true, even a great warfare. He understood the thing, and had understanding of the vision.
verses.ct: In the 3rd year of King Cyrus of Persia, a message was revealed to Daniel (also known as Belteshazzar). The message was true and concerned a great conflict. Daniel understood the message and grasped the meaning of the vision.

verses.kjv: In those days I Daniel was mourning three full weeks.
verses.web: In those days I, Daniel, was mourning three whole weeks.
verses.ct: During that time, I, Daniel, spent 3 full weeks in mourning.

verses.kjv: I ate no pleasant bread, neither came flesh nor wine in my mouth, neither did I anoint myself at all, till three whole weeks were fulfilled.
verses.web: I ate no pleasant bread. No meat or wine came into my mouth. I didn’t anoint myself at all, until three whole weeks were fulfilled.
verses.ct: I ate no rich food. No meat or wine touched my lips, and I didn't use any oils on my body for the entire 3 weeks.

verses.kjv: And in the four and twentieth day of the first month, as I was by the side of the great river, which is Hiddekel;
verses.web: In the twenty-fourth day of the first month, as I was by the side of the great river, which is Hiddekel,
verses.ct: On the 24th day of the first month, I was standing on the bank of the great river — the Tigris.

verses.kjv: Then I lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and behold a certain man clothed in linen, whose loins were girded with fine gold of Uphaz:
verses.web: I lifted up my eyes, and looked, and behold, there was a man clothed in linen, whose thighs were adorned with pure gold of Uphaz.
verses.ct: I looked up and saw a man dressed in linen with a belt of pure gold from Uphaz around his waist.

verses.kjv: His body also was like the beryl, and his face as the appearance of lightning, and his eyes as lamps of fire, and his arms and his feet like in colour to polished brass, and the voice of his words like the voice of a multitude.
verses.web: His body also was like the beryl, and his face as the appearance of lightning, and his eyes as flaming torches. His arms and his feet were like burnished bronze. The voice of his words was like the voice of a multitude.
verses.ct: His body gleamed like beryl. His face flashed like lightning, and his eyes blazed like torches of fire. His arms and feet shone like polished bronze, and his voice thundered like the roar of a vast crowd.

verses.kjv: And I Daniel alone saw the vision: for the men that were with me saw not the vision; but a great quaking fell upon them, so that they fled to hide themselves.
verses.web: I, Daniel, alone saw the vision; for the men who were with me didn’t see the vision; but a great quaking fell on them, and they fled to hide themselves.
verses.ct: I, Daniel, was the only one who saw the vision. The men with me didn't see it, but an overwhelming terror seized them, and they ran and hid.

verses.kjv: Therefore I was left alone, and saw this great vision, and there remained no strength in me: for my comeliness was turned in me into corruption, and I retained no strength.
verses.web: So I was left alone, and saw this great vision. No strength remained in me; for my face grew deathly pale, and I retained no strength.
verses.ct: So I was left alone, staring at this incredible vision. All my strength drained out of me. My face went deathly pale, and I was completely helpless.

verses.kjv: Yet heard I the voice of his words: and when I heard the voice of his words, then was I in a deep sleep on my face, and my face toward the ground.
verses.web: Yet I heard the voice of his words. When I heard the voice of his words, then I fell into a deep sleep on my face, with my face toward the ground.
verses.ct: Then I heard the sound of his voice, and the moment I heard it, I collapsed face-down on the ground in a deep sleep.

verses.kjv: And, behold, an hand touched me, which set me upon my knees and upon the palms of my hands.
verses.web: Behold, a hand touched me, which set me on my knees and on the palms of my hands.
verses.ct: Suddenly a hand touched me and lifted me onto my hands and knees.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, O Daniel, a man greatly beloved, understand the words that I speak unto thee, and stand upright: for unto thee am I now sent. And when he had spoken this word unto me, I stood trembling.
verses.web: He said to me, “Daniel, you greatly beloved man, understand the words that I speak to you, and stand upright; for I have been sent to you, now.” When he had spoken this word to me, I stood trembling.
verses.ct: He said to me, "Daniel, you are deeply loved. Pay close attention to the words I'm about to say to you, and stand up — because I've been sent to you." When he said this, I stood to my feet, still trembling.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, Fear not, Daniel: for from the first day that thou didst set thine heart to understand, and to chasten thyself before thy God, thy words were heard, and I am come for thy words.
verses.web: Then he said to me, “Don’t be afraid, Daniel; for from the first day that you set your heart to understand, and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard. I have come for your words’ sake.
verses.ct: Then he said, "Don't be afraid, Daniel. From the very first day you set your heart to understand and humbled yourself before your God, your words were heard. I've come because of your prayers.

verses.kjv: But the prince of the kingdom of Persia withstood me one and twenty days: but, lo, Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me; and I remained there with the kings of Persia.
verses.web: But the prince of the kingdom of Persia withstood me twenty-one days; but, behold, Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me because I remained there with the kings of Persia.
verses.ct: But the prince of the kingdom of Persia resisted me for 21 days. Then Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me, because I had been detained there with the kings of Persia.

verses.kjv: Now I am come to make thee understand what shall befall thy people in the latter days: for yet the vision is for many days.
verses.web: Now I have come to make you understand what will happen to your people in the latter days; for the vision is yet for many days.”
verses.ct: Now I've come to help you understand what will happen to your people in the last days, because this vision concerns events still far in the future."

verses.kjv: And when he had spoken such words unto me, I set my face toward the ground, and I became dumb.
verses.web: When he had spoken these words to me, I set my face toward the ground, and was mute.
verses.ct: While he was saying these things to me, I bowed my face toward the ground and couldn't speak.

verses.kjv: And, behold, one like the similitude of the sons of men touched my lips: then I opened my mouth, and spake, and said unto him that stood before me, O my lord, by the vision my sorrows are turned upon me, and I have retained no strength.
verses.web: Behold, one in the likeness of the sons of men touched my lips. Then I opened my mouth, and spoke and said to him who stood before me, “My lord, by reason of the vision my sorrows have overtaken me, and I retain no strength.
verses.ct: Then someone who looked like a human being touched my lips. I opened my mouth and said to the one standing before me, "My lord, this vision has overwhelmed me with anguish, and I have no strength left.

verses.kjv: For how can the servant of this my lord talk with this my lord? for as for me, straightway there remained no strength in me, neither is there breath left in me.
verses.web: For how can the servant of this my lord talk with this my lord? For as for me, immediately there remained no strength in me. There was no breath left in me.”
verses.ct: How can someone like me even speak to someone like you, my lord? My strength is gone, and I can barely breathe."

verses.kjv: Then there came again and touched me one like the appearance of a man, and he strengthened me,
verses.web: Then one like the appearance of a man touched me again, and he strengthened me.
verses.ct: Once again, the one who looked like a man touched me and gave me strength.

verses.kjv: And said, O man greatly beloved, fear not: peace be unto thee, be strong, yea, be strong. And when he had spoken unto me, I was strengthened, and said, Let my lord speak; for thou hast strengthened me.
verses.web: He said, “Greatly beloved man, don’t be afraid. Peace be to you. Be strong. Yes, be strong.” When he spoke to me, I was strengthened, and said, “Let my lord speak; for you have strengthened me.”
verses.ct: He said, "You are deeply loved — don't be afraid. Peace to you. Be strong! Yes, be strong!" As he spoke, my strength returned, and I said, "Speak, my lord, for you have strengthened me."

verses.kjv: Then said he, Knowest thou wherefore I come unto thee? and now will I return to fight with the prince of Persia: and when I am gone forth, lo, the prince of Grecia shall come.
verses.web: Then he said, “Do you know why I have come to you? Now I will return to fight with the prince of Persia. When I go out, behold, the prince of Greece will come.
verses.ct: Then he said, "Do you know why I've come to you? Soon I must return to fight against the prince of Persia, and after that, the prince of Greece will come.

verses.kjv: But I will shew thee that which is noted in the scripture of truth: and there is none that holdeth with me in these things, but Michael your prince.
verses.web: But I will tell you that which is inscribed in the writing of truth. There is no one who holds with me against these, but Michael your prince.
verses.ct: But first, I will tell you what is written in the Book of Truth. No one stands with me against these forces except Michael, your prince."
